summary: IN MID-APRIL, MY AIRBAG SERVICE LIGHT/NOTIFICATION BEGAN COMING ON INTERMITTENTLY.  I CONTACTED THE SERVICE DEPARTMENT AT **** AUTO GROUP TO DETERMINE IF THIS WAS A COMMON ISSUE. THEY INDICATED THIS WAS NOT A COMMON ISSUE AND WERE CONCERNED AN AIRBAG WOULD NOT PROPERLY DEPLOY IF I WAS INVOLVED IN AN ACCIDENT.   I BROUGHT THE VEHICLE IN FOR INSPECTION ON APRIL 14TH AND THEY INDICATED THERE WAS AN AIRBAG CONNECTOR ISSUE UNDER THE PASSENGER SEAT (PAPERWORK INDICATES DRIVER SEAT).  THE ADVISOR SAID THIS WAS A SIMPLE REPAIR AND THE TECHNICIAN FIXED IT THAT SAME DAY.   OVER THAT WEEKEND THE AIRBAG SERVICE LIGHT CAME ON MORE FREQUENTLY AND STAYED ON FOR LONGER PERIODS OF TIME.  I BROUGHT THE VEHICLE BACK TO THE SERVICE DEPARTMENT ON APRIL 17TH.  THE DIAGNOSIS THIS TIME WAS MORE IN DEPTH; THE ADVISOR INDICATED THERE WAS AN AIRBAG HIGH RESISTANCE READING ON THE DRIVER SEAT SIDE AIRBAG.  HE STATED THAT I NEEDED THE FOLLOWING PARTS: WIRING HARNESS AND DRIVER'S SIDE IMPACT AIRBAG INFLATOR, TO FIX THE ISSUE.
